post.summary:
CanBillItem is an RPC allowing you to validate the pre-requisites to be
able to bill for an item (via the BillItem RPC) is likely to succeed. Use this
RPC when you want to have a high confidence that billing for an item will be successful,
such as when building activation user interfaces.
This is not a guarantee - payments can still fail (e.g. if the charge amount is above their available limit).

Is a validation check to see if each supplied SKU and quantity will be able to
create a subscription sucessfully for a partner. Returns an object for each SKU whether
the subscription can be created, and reason is provided for if they can or cannot.
This is not a guarantee - payments can still fail (e.g. if the total charge amount is above their available limit).

ReplaceSubscriptionPresets is an RPC that allows you to provide data that will be hydrated when a Subscription is created.
You would call ReplaceSubscriptionPresets to obtain a reference you can later use in a CreateSubscription(s) request.

Sets the renewal start date on an existing subscription. If the renewal start date has already been set, this call will fail.
The current time, coupled with the frequency of the subscription renewal will be used to set renewal start to the current day of the next renewal cycle. (ie next month, or next year)

This endpoint kicks off asynchronous work to backfill the "Revenue Recognition Template" field on Sales Invoices and Credit Notes in Financial Force
Sales Invoices and Credit Notes created by the billing service all have this field filled out, but those documents created manually by users in Financial Force are missing this field
Each month before finance closes out their reporting period, they must run revenue recognition. Each document that contributes to revenue recognition must have a this template field filled out for revenue recognition to work correctly
Since the time it takes to complete month end each month is variable, this backfill cannot simply be kicked off by a cron and instead must be manually triggered by a user when Finance has completed all manual entries to FF

v1CollectionMethod.description:
Collection method describes how the invoice should be collected.

 - COLLECTION_METHOD_INVALID: Invalid means there is no user defined value. This options is invalid.
 - COLLECTION_METHOD_MANUAL: Manual means the merchant will collect payments against the invoice externally.
 - COLLECTION_METHOD_EMAIL: The invoice will be emailed to the recipient user defined on the recurring invoice. The user can make their payment
towards the invoice from the page the email directs them to.
 - COLLECTION_METHOD_CHARGE_AUTOMATICALLY: Automatically charge the card on file.

v1ComponentPricing.description:
A Component represents some metered element or consumable which exists on a product.
For example, Google bills "Instance Hours" as a metered component.
Each component is identified by an ID and has a 'Unit Price' which will be multiplied by
the quantity of component used to get the total cost of that component.

id.description:
A unique identifier for the recurring invoice.
This property is read-only. It will be ignored on create.
Update requests require this property to be set to identify the recurring invoice to update.

created.description:
The time the recurring invoice was created at.

This is read-only.

updated.description:
When the recurring invoice was last updated.

This is read-only.

customerId.description:
The id of the customer the recurring invoice belongs to.

This is required.

status.description:
The status indicates whether an invoice will be generated.

This is required.

nextIssue.description:
When the next invoice will be generated.

This property is required.

intervalCount.description:
This is the number of intervals that will pass before an invoice is created.
For example, an interval count of "2" and interval of "week" will result in an invoice being generated every
2 weeks.

This property is required. It must be greater than 0.

interval.description:
The interval that invoices will be generated at.

This property is required.

repeatOnDayOfMonth.description:
The day of the month the invoice will be sent on when using month or year intervals.

If the month the invoice is being generated on has fewer days than this value, it will be sent at the end of the
month. To send an invoice at the end of every month, this value can be set to 31.

This property is only required when the interval is INTERVAL_MONTH or INTERVAL_YEAR. It must be greater than
or equal to 1 or less than or equal to 31.

collectionMethod.description:
The collection method describes how the invoice generated will be collected.

This property is required.

recipientUserId.description:
The user id of the user who will receive any emails regarding the invoice.

This property is required if the collection method is not COLLECTION_METHOD_MANUAL.

paymentProcessor.description:
The payment processor defines what third party processor is responsible for handling the payments of this recurring
invoice.

This property is required if the collection method is COLLECTION_METHOD_CHARGE_AUTOMATICALLY.

paymentProcessorId.description:
The id of the payment method in the payment processor's system.
For example, if the payment processor is Stripe, the processor id would be a payment method in Stripe's system like
pm_1VJJRx3f57oEAmiusv4IWGS7.

This is required if the collection method is COLLECTION_METHOD_CHARGE_AUTOMATICALLY.

items.description:
Items to be added to the next invoice.

This property is required.

totalAmount.description:
The total amount of the invoice.

This property is read-only.

currencyCode.description:
The ISO currency code of the invoice.

This property is read-only.

memo.title: An arbitrary note which appears on the invoice

endsAt.description:
Invoices will no longer be created after the ends at time.

This property is optional. If it's not set, invoices will be generated indefinitely.

netD.description:
The number of days after the invoice is issued that it is due. This property is optional, but should be between 1 and 180 if set.
Setting this property when collection method is COLLECTION_METHOD_CHARGE_AUTOMATICALLY is not permitted.

If this property is not set, it will default to 1 day when collection method is set to COLLECTION_METHOD_CHARGE_AUTOMATICALLY
and 10 days for other collection methods.

additionalRecipientIds.description: The user ids of additional recipients who will receive any emails regarding the invoice.

paymentMethodTypes.title: The payment_method_types define how a Customer can pay for the Invoice (defaults to card)

v1RecurringInvoice.description: Recurring invoices allow for invoices to be generated at a set interval for an account.

hideLineItems.description:
Hiding the line items will result in only the bundle being shown as a single line item without showing the line
items which comprise it. The line item total will be the sum of its line items.

This is optional. It defaults to false.

lineItems.description:
The line items of the bundle.

This is required.

v1RecurringInvoiceBundle.description:
A recurring invoice line item bundle is one or more line items which should be grouped together on the invoice.
The bundle can be given its own name, and the line items may be hidden from the invoice sent to the user.

address.title: The street address of the customer

zip.title: The zip code of the customer

address2.title: The second street address of the customer

lineItem.description: A line item for a single product.

bundle.description:
A line item bundle is one or more products which should be shown as a group on the invoice.
The line items that make up the bundle may be hidden from the user.

v1RecurringInvoiceItem.description: Recurring invoice items are the line items or bundles which will be shown on the invoice.

sku.description:
The marketplace SKU for the product.

This is optional.

unitPrice.description:
The price for a single unit. This is represented as the lowest value unit of the currency. For example, if the
account uses USD, $10.00 should be represented as 1000 cents.

This is optional. Default is 0. This can be negative, but the total amount of the invoice must be greater
than or equal to zero.

quantity.description:
The number of products being charged. The total value of this line item would be unit_amount * quantity.

This is required. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

name.description:
The name of the line item.

This is required.

taxRateIds.description:
A list of the tax rate ids which apply to this invoice.

This is optional.

v1RecurringInvoiceLineItem.description: Recurring invoice line items are the individual products that make up a line item for a recurring invoice.

v1RecurringInvoiceStatus.description:
- RECURRING_INVOICE_STATUS_INVALID: Invalid means there is no user defined value. This option is invalid.
 - RECURRING_INVOICE_STATUS_INACTIVE: The invoices will not bet sent from this recurring invoice.
 - RECURRING_INVOICE_STATUS_ACTIVE: The recurring invoice will generate invoices.
 - RECURRING_INVOICE_STATUS_ARCHIVED: The recurring invoice is no longer used. It will not generate any future invoices, however they are still visible
to users.

v1RelationshipType.title: - RELATIONSHIP_TYPE_ASSOCIATED_WITH: RELATIONSHIP_TYPE_ASSOCIATED_WITH is used to indicate that the origin entity is associated with the target entity (For example, a retail subscription is associated with the wholesale subscription)

v1RenewalState.description:
Renewal State is used when creating a new subscription (billable item).

 - RENEWAL_STATE_IMMEDIATE: The subscription will be created in a recurring state upon successfully being billed. The next renewal date will be automatically set based upon the start_date.
 - RENEWAL_STATE_DELAYED: The subscription will be created in a non recurring state upon successfully being billed. The next renewal date will be set at a later time.

subscriptionIds.description:
If not provided in the request, this is a generated subscription_id that can later be used in CreateSubscription(s) requests.
